page.title: 15 Sick Benefit Society
page.content: When the sick club was formed in Padbury about 130 years ago there was no National insurance or sick pay from the estate.The villages worked locally mostly as farm labourers, and were fairly poor.They paid quarterly into the club, which then gave them money when they were ill.Money is still paid out to widows,although the club is not need now as it was years ago. Members were fined if they did not attend both club meetings and church regulary. Each year the club has a feast day at Whitsun. On Whit sunday a band, once the village band,but now GT Horwood band, plays in the church,then by the war memoral. On Whit Monday the band marches round the village,going from pub to pub.At 1.30 the procession arives at the Village Hall,formerly the school,where the men eat a Traditional dinner of roast beef & beer.
